lines: You must be the new resident. Well met, stranger.
Just as a flame needs fresh kindling, a little town like this can always use more good folk.
I am Tia. Some call me the Great Firedrake. Mostly it is I who calls myself this.
I come from the mountains. Like you, I have not been in Pebblewick long.
Let us make new lives here together, hm? At the edge of the world.
You return. I see words smouldering behind your eyes.
Speak, and let them rise.
I am proud to bear such a title. Hardly can I recall a time when fire did not fascinate me.
Such a diverse wonder, wouldn’t you agree? Fire is not just destruction. It is life. Rebirth. Passion.
Yet, all too many fear it. Yes, it can be a dangerous thing… but when treated with care, it is the most beautiful force of our world.
I once saw fire dancers spin flame like ribbon in the air. Oh, you should’ve seen them. That memory still glows within me.
That reminds me… Lately, I’ve been yearning to kindle something of my own.
If you find any kindling about, do let me know. I feel a new fire stirring, and it needs a spark.
I once lived atop the highest crags, where clouds roamed and stars hung just above my horns.
I shared that sky with another dragon—Shen. Oh, how he adored the stars… Called them “sky-flames”.
It was Shen who taught me that fire could be more than heat and ruin. He gave it poetry.
This is a good town. Sheltered. Warm. Not like the mountains—but good.
I do not know the people well, but they have been kind.
That Liss—she’s something special, isn’t she?
I watch her work the forge sometimes. Rarely have I seen anyone wield fire with such strength… and such care.
Ah, this will do perfectly! Thank you very much.
I wish I could tell you… but some fires are hard to name, and harder still to face.
I’m not sure I have the strength to light this one.
Very well, stranger. Or should I say… friend.
Stand with me now, as I light this fire. For Shen.
Shen was my truest friend.
For a hundred years, we soared, laughed, lazed…
At night, we would lie on the cliff’s edge and name every sky-flame that we could see.
Then, one day, his fire went out. Not even the stars felt warm after that.
I miss him more than anything.
Ah… I wondered where I left that.
This map’s been with me a long time. Shen and his stars… ‘Sky-flames,’ he called them—sparks of stories drifting in the dark.
We’d lie on the cliff edge and name them one by one. Then we’d draw them here, by claw and coal…
Please, keep looking, if you’d like.
Greetings, good friend.
Pebblewick glows brighter in your warmth.
